channel.title: Daily Express :: Music Feed
channel.description: Simply The Best 7 Days A Week

item.title: Brian May shares his ‘insanely optimistic’ new music video for On My Way Up – WATCH
item.description: BRIAN MAY has unveiled a brand new and innovative music video for his joyful solo classic On My Way Up. The release coincides with the deluxe reissue of the Queen legend's previously unobtainable Another World album, which has been released today. A special version of the track also features on the new version of the record which the 74-year-old is particularly fond of because "it's very kind of rude and raw".

item.title: Elvis death: Last person to see The King’s body before his open casket was closed – WATCH
item.description: ELVIS PRESLEY's body was put on display in an open casket for two days after his death, just before his funeral. Now a close family member has shared who they believe was the last to see The King's body before the coffin was closed for the final time.

item.title: Brian May’s ‘joy’ over Freddie Mercury’s ‘precious’ Bohemian Rhapsody choice – WATCH
item.description: BRIAN MAY has opened up on his very personal songwriting process, sharing how he has something particularly in common there with Freddie Mercury, who wrote Bohemian Rhapsody among other Queen hits. Promoting the re-release of his Another World album, the guitarist also candidly spoke of how working on his solo music he found he continually has regarded himself as a "disaster" and understanding that has made him want to be "less of a miserable bastard".

item.title: Mick Jagger explains why Rolling Stones stopped playing controversial hit Brown Sugar
item.description: MICK Jagger says the Rolling Stones took the decision to axe Brown Sugar from their setlist over its links to slavery.

item.title: George Harrison was 'not a fan' of Paul McCartney's music
item.description: GEORGE HARRISON didn't always see eye-to-eye with his fellow member of The Beatles, Paul McCartney. And when the band split up, he revealed he "did not" enjoy "pushy" McCartney's solo music. He confessed he preferred some of the star's older music.

item.title: 'There was no warning' Elvis Presley 'terrified' Priscilla by shooting gun at TV
item.description: ELVIS PRESLEY was a passionate gun fan, and would frequently blast at things that frustrated him or that he didn't agree with. Priscilla Presley admitted she was "scared" of the star after he randomly shot a TV in their house. Even Lisa Marie Presley questioned why the star did it.

item.title: Freddie Mercury Tribute Concert: 30th anniversary show available for limited time
item.description: FREDDIE MERCURY fans will be able to watch the legendary Tribute Concert this week for free to commemorate 30 years since the star's death - but act fast, as it will run out. The Daily Express has all the details on how to watch the momentous event that saw some of the biggest music stars perform, and had Hollywood icon Elizabeth Taylor beg attendees to practise safe sex.

item.title: John Lennon thought The Beatles were nothing but 'a fad'
item.description: JOHN LENNON was not completely confident about The Beatles' longevity. Shortly after they made their debut in the USA he revealed he thought the band was a passing "fad". He also thought the British group would "not last another five years".

item.title: Oasis's Liam Gallagher says he needs a new hip but would rather be in pain
item.description: LIAM Gallagher needs a hip replacement - but would rather roll with it and ask his partner to wheel him about.

item.title: Elvis Presley fury left Priscilla Presley 'terrified' of her husband
item.description: ELVIS PRESLEY got all shook up in an argument with his soon-to-be wife, Priscilla Presley, when she gave him some advice about his music. His comments made her "terrified" of what he might do next. Priscilla, just a teenage girl at the time, fought back tears while maintaining that she was only trying to help with his career.
